replies.bodyText:
Yes, that is possible.
tbh Currently I am not very happy with this hard-coded comparison. I guess it is done in other bindings too. But maybe a user wants battery low warnings depending on a different threshold? A config parameter seem to be to clumsy.
I thought about implementing a profile for this use case.
replies.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: It can also be implemented with a simple rule. Creating a profile seems to me as the profile is 'misused' as a method to create shortcuts for simple rules. I'm not sure if that is the intention of profiles? I can see a case for being able to easily create simple rule like features. And could be something for a rule template.
replies.author: Hilbrand

replies.bodyText: I think you are right. A rule is sufficient.
replies.author: cweitkamp
